channel.title: Data Breach & Ransomware Aggregator

item.description:

item.title: Mass Spam Attacks Leverage Zendesk Instances
item.description:
The CRM vendor advised ignoring or deleting suspicious emails and said the attacks were not tied to any breach or software vulnerability.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: 'CrashFix' Scam Crashes Browsers, Delivers Malware
item.description:
The attack consists of a NexShield malicious browser extension, a social engineering technique to crash the browser, and a Python-based RAT.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: 'Damn Vulnerable' Training Apps Leave Vendors' Clouds Exposed
item.description:
Hackers are already leveraging these over-permissioned programs to access the IT systems of major security vendors.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Complex VoidLink Linux Malware Created by AI
item.description:
Researchers say the advanced framework was built almost entirely by agents, marking a significant evolution in the use of AI to develop wholly original malware.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Phishing Campaign Zeroes in on LastPass Customers
item.description:

ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: 'Contagious Interview' Attack Now Delivers Backdoor Via VS Code
item.description:
Once trust is granted to the repository's author, a malicious app executes arbitrary commands on the victim's system with no other user interaction.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: AI Agents Undermine Progress in Browser Security
item.description:
Web browser companies have put in substantial effort over the past three decades to strengthen the browser security stack against abuses. Agentic browsers are undoing all that work.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Dark Reading Confidential: Reviving the Hacker Ethos That Built Cybersecurity
item.description:
Dark Reading Confidential Episode 14: How curious, ethical problem solving can continue to serve as a guiding principle for an evolving cybersecurity sector.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Latin American Orgs Lack Confidence in Cyber Defenses, Skills
item.description:
Cybersecurity professionals in Latin America are least likely to have faith in their countries' preparedness for cyberattacks on critical infrastructure, the World Economic Forum says.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.description:

ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Exploited Zero-Day Flaw in Cisco UC Could Affect Millions

item.title: The Upside Down is Real: What Stranger Things Teaches Us About Modern Cybersecurity
item.description:

item.title: Cyberattack disrupts digital systems at renowned Dresden museum network
item.description:
Germany's Dresden State Art Collections network said it was able to keep facilities open and protect artworks while responding to a cyberattack against large portions of its digital infrastructure.
ğŸ“° Source: The Record | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Dismantling Defenses: Trump 2.0 Cyber Year in Review
item.description:
The Trump administration has pursued a staggering range of policy pivots this past year that threaten to weaken the nationâ€™s ability and willingness to address a broad spectrum of technology challenges, from cybersecurity and privacy to countering disinformation, fraud and corruption. These shifts, along with the presidentâ€™s efforts to restrict free speech and freedom of the press, have come at such a rapid clip that many readers probably arenâ€™t even aware of them all.
ğŸ“° Source: Krebs on Security | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Happy 16th Birthday, KrebsOnSecurity.com!
item.description:
KrebsOnSecurity.com celebrates its 16th anniversary today! A huge "thank you" to all of our readers -- newcomers, long-timers and drive-by critics alike. Your engagement this past year here has been tremendous and truly a salve on a handful of dark days. Happily, comeuppance was a strong theme running through our coverage in 2025, with a primary focus on entities that enabled complex and globally-dispersed cybercrime services.
ğŸ“° Source: Krebs on Security | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: DOGE Employees Shared Social Security Data, Court Filing Shows
item.description:
Eileen Sullivan reports: Employees with the Department of Government Efficiency who were detailed to the Social Security Administration last March shared sensitive data through a nonsecure third party server, in violation of agency security policies, the Justice Department disclosed in a court filing. The Social Security Administration does not know what data was shared on... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Hong Kong issues Code of Practice under the Protection of Critical Infrastructures (Computer Systems) Ordinance
item.description:
Gabriela Kennedy, Joanna K.C. Wong, and Roslie Liu of Mayer|Brown write: On 1 January 2026, the Office of the Commissioner of Critical Infrastructure (Computer-system Security) issued a Code of Practice (the â€œCoPâ€) under the Protection of Critical Infrastructures (Computer Systems) Ordinance (Cap. 653) (the â€œOrdinanceâ€), which came into force on the same day (see our... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: EPIC Releases New Report on Protecting Health Privacy in the Digital Age
item.description:
Today the Electronic Privacy Information Center (EPIC) releasedÂ Beyond HIPAA: Reimagining How Privacy Laws Apply to Health Data to Maximize Equity in the Digital Age.Â The reportÂ examinesÂ and proposes solutions toÂ the health data privacy crisisâ€”a product ofÂ unregulated digital technologies,Â weak privacy laws,Â theÂ criminalizationÂ ofÂ many forms ofÂ health care, and growingÂ federal attacks on marginalized communities. Through commercialÂ surveillance,Â our health data is extractedÂ to profile us,Â reveal
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Zendesk ticket systems hijacked in massive global spam wave
item.description:
Lawrence Abrams reports: People worldwide are being targeted by a massive spam wave originating from unsecured Zendesk support systems, with victims reporting receiving hundreds of emails with strange and sometimes alarming subject lines. The wave of spam messages started on January 18th, withÂ people reportingÂ onÂ social mediaÂ that they received hundreds of emails. While the messages do not... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Europeâ€™s GDPR cops dished out â‚¬1.2B in fines last year as data breaches piled up
item.description:
Carly Page reports: GDPR fines pushed past the Â£1 billion (â‚¬1.2 billion) mark in 2025 as Europeâ€™s regulators were deluged with more than 400Â data breach notifications a day, according to a new survey that suggests the post-plateau era of enforcement has well and truly arrived. The figures come fromÂ the latest GDPR Fines and Data Breach... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Kazakhstan Considers Criminal Liability for Mass Leaks of Personal Data
item.description:
Dmitry Pokidaev reports: Kazakhstan is considering tightening legal responsibility for violations related to personal data protection. The Ministry of Artificial Intelligence and Digital Development has proposed introducing criminal liability for mass leaks of citizensâ€™ personal data, along with a significant increase in administrative fines for failing to comply with information security requirements. The proposal was... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: NL: Police warned about security hole used by Russian hackers in major theft of police data
item.description:
NL Times reports: The Dutch police knew about gaps in their cybersecurity beforeÂ a Russian cyber groupÂ stole a large amount of police data in September 2024, according to research byÂ Follow the Money. The hackers used vulnerabilities that the police had been warned about. The hackers gained access through an employeeâ€™s email account and stole theÂ contact details... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: INC ransomware opsec fail allowed data recovery for 12 US orgs
item.description:
Bill Toulas reports: An operational security failure allowed researchers to recover data that the INC ransomware gang stole from a dozen U.S. organizations. A deep forensic examination of the artifacts left behind uncovered tooling that had not been used in the investigated attack, but exposed attacker infrastructure that stored data exfiltrated from multiple victims. The... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: ShinyHunters group opens new dark web leak site, claims responsibility for OKTA vishing campaign
item.description:
Over on LinkedIn, AlonGal of Hudson Rock wrote: BIG â€“ ShinyHunters confirmed to me that they are behind the recent Okta vishing campaign and have published alleged data from three major victims (Crunchbase, SoundCloud, and Betterment) on their new blog, stating more are coming. ğŸ”½ I was approached by ShinyHunters following a BleepingComputer report yesterday... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Microsoft Gave FBI Keys To Unlock Encrypted Data, Exposing Major Privacy Concern
item.description:
Thomas Brewster reports: Early last year, the FBI served Microsoft with a search warrant, asking it to provide recovery keys to unlock encrypted data stored on three laptops. Federal investigators in Guam believed the devices held evidence that would help prove individuals handling the islandâ€™s Covid unemployment assistance program were part of a plot to... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Okta SSO accounts targeted in vishing-based data theft attacks
item.description:
Okta is warning about custom phishing kits built specifically for voice-based social engineering (vishing) attacks. BleepingComputer has learned that these kits are being used in active attacks to steal Okta SSO credentials for data theft. [...]
ğŸ“° Source: BleepingComputer | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Security News

item.title: Hackers get $1,047,000 for 76 zero-days at Pwn2Own Automotive 2026
item.description:
Pwn2Own Automotive 2026 has ended with security researchers earning $1,047,000 after exploiting 76 zero-day vulnerabilities between January 21 and January 23. [...]
ğŸ“° Source: BleepingComputer | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Security News

item.title: Hackers exploit critical telnetd auth bypass flaw to get root
item.description:
A coordinated campaign has been observed targeting a recently disclosedÂ critical-severity vulnerability that has been present in theÂ GNU InetUtils telnetd server for 11 years. [...]
ğŸ“° Source: BleepingComputer | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Security News

item.title: ShinyHunters claim to be behind SSO-account data theft attacks
item.description:
The ShinyHunters extortion gang claims it is behind a wave of ongoing voice phishing attacks targeting single sign-on (SSO) accounts at Okta, Microsoft, and Google, enabling threat actors to breach corporate SaaS platforms and steal company data for extortion. [...]
ğŸ“° Source: BleepingComputer | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Security News
